title: RMCAD
content:
My ongoing search for a good Graphic Design program within a university has lead me to the following schools:

RMCAD, Denver, CO  
 [http://www.rmcad.edu/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020063055/http:/www.rmcad.edu/ "http://www.rmcad.edu/")

University of North Texas, Denton, TX  
 [http://www.art.unt.edu/course-listings.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020063055/http:/www.art.unt.edu/course-listings.html "http://www.art.unt.edu/course-listings.html")

If there are any alumni from either school on Typophile, I'd like to know what you think about the curriculum, difficulty, etc...

I'd also like to know what other people think of the schools whether they've attended or not.

Thanks.
author: Carolann

comments.content: Are you targeting a certain region in the US to attend school?

I am. I know that RISD, New York, California, and Georgia have ideal schools but they are more expensive than what I can afford. My boyfriend and I are also planning on getting married in about a year so we're trying to gravitate toward places where he has a network of job leads and I have a good school to go to.

Thus we've started narrowing things down to the Dallas area, Colorado, and possibly North Carolina.
